## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
data=read.csv('~/Documents/GitHub/Intro-to-DS-Group-6/Video games sales.csv')
str(data)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
total_sales<-colSums(data[,c("NA_Sales", "EU_Sales", "JP_Sales", "Other_Sales", "Global_Sales")])
print(total_sales)
```

Total number of sales

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
```{r}
top_games_na <- data[order(-data$NA_Sales), ][1, ]
top_games_eu <- data[order(-data$EU_Sales), ][1, ]
top_games_jp <- data[order(-data$JP_Sales), ][1, ]
top_games_global <- data[order(-data$Global_Sales), ][1, ]
top_games_other <- data[order(-data$Other_Sales), ][1, ]
print(top_games_na)
print(top_games_eu)
print(top_games_jp)
print(top_games_global)
print(top_games_other)
```

```{r}
top_selling_games <- bind_rows(top_games_na ,top_games_eu,top_games_jp,top_games_global,top_games_other)
top_selling_games
```
